intro: Cyphostemma bainesii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It is often found growing in rocky or disturbed habitats, and it has a slow growth rate. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
